titleStmt.title:
A Funeral Apotheosis on the Tribunes, a paper so
called wch came out in Ireland.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l:
──Ingentem luctum ne quære tuorum:
Ostendunt terris hunc tantum Fata, neq; ultra
esse sinent.────── Virg: En. 6.
To what a Dull & dismal pass!
A──b──kle's labours come! Alas!
How very little is the distance
between their ruin, & existance!
They hardly enter into light
but they return again to Night,
& their memorial even then
are lost among the sons of Men!
The case is hard, but can't be help'd:
so Mungril-puppys newly whelp'd,
to stop the growth of Curs, are hurl'd
blind, as they came, out of the world.
That Spungy brain in which there swims
a maze of dark pragmatic whims,
which jump to figures at a Venture
like Atoms, justled to a Centre;
that Brain wch bred a greater store
of Monsters than Ægyptus bore,
yet still survives the dire destructions
of all its manifold productions.
His Satyrs, Madrigals & Journal
have been demolish'd in their turn all,
some by the Grocers & the Cooks,
treated like paultry idle books;
by Smoakers some, & some by shiters
those enemies to Modern writers,
foul Miscreants! a project scarce is
out of his head, but's at your A──s.
so when the bum her Portal opes
if peradventure wind elopes,
as down that falls, this upward goes,
& presently insults the Nose.
tho this indeed is not so sav'ry
however that may smell of Knav'ry.
Old Nestors Case (who liv'd so long
as we are told in Homer's Song

he sum'd his years upon his ·Jam dextra computat annos.
«LDJuv:.» knuckles)
was not so wretched as A──b──ckle's.
He, when Antilochus appear'd
with wrinkled Brow, & bushy bear'd,
much wept & much complain'd of Fate,
that gave his life so long a date.
How much more wou'd he weep to see
the Death of all his progeny!
Alas! how would the goodman mourn
for ev'ry bear'd to count an Urn!
The Tribunes that in Powel's shop
with Latin Lemma at the top,
premis'd the Author's depth of Learning
to gentle readers of discerning,
like all the writings heretofore,
of poor A──b──ckle are no more!
I say no sooner were they written,
& printed, but they were besh────n!
that very day that gave 'em breath;
gave them for ever up to death,
wet from the Printing press in sheets
they flew like Hail about the streets,
but the time that they were dry'd,
were silent, disapear'd, & dy'd,
thus high above their native sphere
fishes are said to mount in air;
but when their fins are dry'd, again
descend into their native main;
yet with this difference we think,
they as they list can rise or sink,
as Thetis wets or Phæbus dries;
the Tribunes sink── but nev'r rise.
